conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces per wall are visible, and the camera is angled with ceiling removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness, readable corners, distinct floor plane, and clean cutaway; only minor simplification in some junctions/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set (kitchen/dining/living/bath/stairs) is present, but there is a major layout deviation: a long interior partition appears to separate dining and living, while the 2D plan shows the right side as an open combined space (no wall line between dining and living). Bathroom door placement/orientation also appears different from the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Kitchen run with stove/cabinets, dining table/chairs, living sofa/coffee table, and toilet are present; bathroom fixtures are incomplete vs plan (sink not clearly present).

visual_clarity.notes: Clean render with good readability of walls/openings and minimal artifacts; lighting supports visibility and presentation is uncluttered.

detected_errors.description: Interior wall added/retained between dining and living zones in 3D, but 2D plan indicates an open right-side space without a separating partition.
Door placement/orientation for the bathroom appears mismatched relative to the 2D plan (connection side differs).
Bathroom fixture set is incomplete vs plan (sink/vanity not clearly represented).

summary: A valid and clear 3D cutaway was produced, but major internal partition/door discrepancies reduce geometric fidelity to the original 2D layout.
